snippet: The fund left its 2012 outlook steady at 3.5 percent, though it warned that without greater action on the European debt crisis its forecasts might prove optimistic.
abstract: International Monetary Fund leaves its 2012 economic growth forecast steady at 3.5 percent, though it warns that without greater action on the European sovereign debt crisis its forecasts might prove optimistic; cuts its 2013 forecast to 3.9 percent from earlier estimate of 4.1 percent.
lead_paragraph: The fund left its 2012 outlook steady at 3.5 percent, though it warned that without greater action on the European debt crisis its forecasts might prove optimistic.

headline.seo: I.M.F. Reduces Next Year’s Growth Forecast to 3.9%
headline.main: I.M.F. Trims 2013 Forecast for Growth to 3.9%
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Trims 2013 Forecast For Growth To 3.9%
